brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-centre, cross-over study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of using the bion, an implantable medical device, for the treatment of chronic headaches. The clinical study is proposed to determine the anticipated adverse event rate and treatment outcomes at the conclusion of the study. Each trial subject will serve as his/her own control.

primary_outcome.measure: Demonstrate acceptable rate of adverse events.
The primary efficacy measure is a significant reduction in either headache frequency or severity

arm_group.description: Occipital nerve stimulation (ONS) therapy delivered to a subject implanted with a bion ONS device

intervention.description: Stimulation on from initial activation and on.
